RasterData class¶

class RasterData.RasterData(data, gridSpacing, **kwargs)[source]¶

A raster representation of the point set and manipulations on it

Attributes

Methods

Transforms raster to PointSet data

Returns

PointSet of the raster data

Return type

PointSet

accuracy¶

Measurement accuracy

cols¶

Number of columns in the raster

getGtidPoints(xmin=None, ymin=None, xmax=None, ymax=None, spatialRef=None)[source]¶
intepolateAtPixel(row, col, method='bilinear')[source]¶

Computing the height(s) of a given pixel(s) based on a given method

Parameters

  • row – The row(s) of the pixel(s)

  • col – The column(s) of the pixel(s)

  • method – The method to be used for the interpolation (same as methods as in interpolateAtPoint method)

Returns

interpolateAtPoint(x, y, spatialRef=None, method='bilinear')[source]¶

Computing the height(s) of a given point(s) based on a given method

Parameters

  • x – x-coordinate(s) of the point(s)

  • y – y-coordinate(s) of the point(s)

  • spatialRef – The spatial reference of the point(s), given as an ESPG code

  • method – The method to be used for the interpolation: - ‘nearest’ - for nearest neighbor - ‘bilinear’ - for bilinear intepolation (default) - ‘bicubic’ - for bicubic interpolation (to be implemented)

Returns

min_range¶

The closest range in the data

pixelToWorld(row, col)[source]¶

Transform a pixel to world coordinate system

Parameters

  • row (int) – the pixel’s row

  • col (int) – the pixel’s column

Returns

x, y in world coordinates

Return type

tuple

resolution¶

Raster resolution

roughness(**kwargs)[source]¶

An estimation of the surface roughness

rows¶

Number of rows in the raster

scaleX¶
scaleY¶
setValues(**kwargs)[source]¶

sets self values

Parameters

  • voidData (int) – A number indicating missing data in the raster

  • geoTrnasform (tuple) – The transformation needed to convert from pixel to world coordinates (tx, ty, sx, sx)

  • spatialReference – spatial reference info

  • dataOrigin (str) – A string indicating the point acquiring means: ‘terrestrial’,

  • dataFeature (str) – A string indicating the type of data stored (e.g. range, intensity, etc.)

  • accuracy (float) – measurement accuracy estimation

  • roughness (float) – an estimation of the surface roughness

  • path (str) – the path for the datafile

shape¶

Raster’s rows and columns size

spatialReference¶

The spatial reference information

translationX¶

The east translation

translationY¶

The north translation

voidData¶

The value set to represent void data (usually when exported from arcgis or qgis)

Return type

int

worldToPixel(x, y, spatialRef=None)[source]¶

Conversion of a point from world coordinates to pixel ones

Parameters

  • x (float) – The X-axis coordinate of the point to convert

  • y (float) – The Y-axis coordinate of the point to convert

  • spatialRef (ESPG code) – The spatial reference of the point to convert given in EPSG code

Returns

the row and column that correspond to the given point (tuple of two float numbers)

Return type

tuple (int, int)
